cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi ESE of Caibarien, Cuba and 275 mi SSE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest today, move along the Florida Keys Sunday morning, cross the Florida peninsula Sunday-night/Monday, and track inland across south-central Georgia Monday night toward Alabama

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Volusia/Brevard County line FL northward to Fernandina Beach FL; Storm-Surge Watch north of that to Suwannee River FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Volusia/Brevard County line southward around entire Florida peninsula to Anclote River, including Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through Georgia and South Carolina likely to receive tropical-storm-force winds, heavy rain and coastal flooding
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) likely Monday with a 12 % chance of sustained 50-kt (58 mph) winds; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if Irma tracks closer to the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft surge along the Georgia coast, locally higher if the center passes nearer or during high tide, leading to moderate coastal flooding in the Savannah River and adjacent marshes.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain with isolated totals near 20 inches possible across southeast Georgia, producing flash-flood risk in the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rain bands; very rough seas, dangerous surf and rip currents disrupting vessel movements and cargo operations.
